jobs.title: Prompt Engineer (M/W/NB)
jobs.description:
Company Description

Ubisoft is a global leader in gaming with teams across the world creating original and memorable gaming experiences, from Assassins Creed, Rainbow Six to Just Dance and more. We believe diverse perspectives help both players and teams thrive. If youre passionate about innovation and pushing entertainment boundaries, join our journey and help us create the unknown!

Ubisoft's pioneering studio, Paris studio was responsible for the publisher's first successes following its creation in 1992. Today, it is at the helm of such must-have licenses as Just Dance, Ghost Recon and Mario + The Rabbids. Ubisoft Paris has also built a solid reputation as a partner of choice in cross-studio collaborations such as Watch Dogs, Skull & Bones, Beyond Good & Evil 2 and Star Wars. Building on this experience, the studio continues to push the boundaries of creativity by working on some very promising yet unannounced projects.

With 750 talents of 35 nationalities, Ubisoft Paris is today the largest studio in France and one of the most experienced in the industry. Young talents can benefit from the strong presence of senior profiles in the creative, technical or artistic fields. Everyone is driven by the same passion: to push the limits of what is possible and to offer new experiences to our players.

Ready to join the adventure? Join us at the Paris Studio!

Job Description

In this role, youll join a team developing a tech product designed to integrate AI features into our games. Within our production studios, youll work at the intersection of AI, design, and quality assurance teamsallowing you to bring your expertise in prompt engineering and AI to create unique gaming experiences.

As a Prompt Engineer (M/W/NB), your responsibilities will include:


Participating in the scoping and design of AI-driven game features;Ensuring the technology is accessible and usable by different departments;Guaranteeing prompt content consistency across environments by testing how changes impact performance (error correction, divergence detection, rewording and clarification), while aiming to optimize latency and cost;Helping define and promote best practices for prompt engineering and supporting teams in implementing them;Contributing to the creation of both manual and automated test scenarios in collaboration with QA and AI teams;Analyzing bugs and feedback, identifying those related to prompt content, and suggesting improvements;Helping identify and test new machine learning models, as well as designing tools to support their use;Staying up to date on the latest in prompt engineering and AI research.


Qualifications


Passionate about video games, with at least one prior experience in a tech company;Proven experience designing prompts for various tasks and across multiple providers. Youre familiar with concepts like agents and function calling, reasoning strategies, chain/tree of thought approaches, zero-shot & few-shot learning, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG);Solid understanding of several language models (GPT-4, Gemini, Claude, Qwen, SentenceBERT, Llama, Mistral, etc.) and their key differences;Fluent in both English, written and spoken (French is a plus). You are also known for your strong writing skills;Strong listening and comprehension skills, with the ability to translate user needs into clear specifications;Capable of adapting your analysis and communication style to reach a wide range of stakeholders;Independent and curious by nature.


Bonus points for:


Programming skills (Python, C#, etc.) and experience working with AI APIs;Experience in narrative content creation (dialogue, quests, world-building) and/or role-playing games;A good understanding of video game design principles.


When reviewing applications, particular attention will be paid to the quality of the cover letter. We will favor a concise text that demonstrates a clear understanding of the position and highlights one or two well-targeted experiences and/or skills, rather than a long, generic letter that simply reiterates your rsum.

Additional Information

Joining us means having access from day one to:


Flexible working hours and the possibility to work remotely up to two days per week, in accordance with Ubisofts remote work policy;20 days of remote work per year from a European Union country (eligibility limited to EU citizens);Our internal e-learning platform to finally train on the tools youve always wanted to master;Our game library where you can borrow the latest Ubisoft titles, competitor games, consoles, and board games;Our works council (CSE) offering discounted rates on a wide range of shows, cinemas, concerts, gyms, amusement parks, and many other great deals.


And after one year?


Youll have a career and development plan established with your manager, along with clear goals to help you grow each year;Youll have joined one of our clubs: choir, yoga, tennis, lightsaber or even created your own!Youll enjoy your 1.5-hour lunch break by taking a class in our gym or borrowing one of our bikes for a ride in the Bois de Vincennes;Youll be looking forward to the next surf/yoga or ski weekend organized by the CSE;Youll have become unbeatable at foosball, climbing, Just Dance, or Boomerang Fu;Youll have raided the internal sale to complete your collection of Ubisoft goodies and games (because you can never have too many).


Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer and offers all individuals the same access to employment, regardless of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, social status, disability, or age. Ubisoft is committed to fostering an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of its player community.

Check out this guide to help you with your application, and learn about our actions to encourage more diversity and inclusion.

Job Title: Data EngineerLocation: Paris, France (Le Marais neighborhood)Entity: The Redesign Group FRDepartment: Redesign AI Work Arrangement: On-site
The Redesign Group is a global business, design and technology consultancy specializing in transformational services that help organizations achieve their potential. 
We're expanding our newly formed Redesign AI team to help small to mid-sized businesses adopt AI engine technologies. 
As a Data Engineer, you'll be responsible for assisting our Product Development team with making strategic data sources available to models, LLMs and Agents for a variety of business use cases. 
At Redesign, we believe the future belongs to the curious. Join us to help build emerging cognitive architecture that enables curiosity to flourish within the workplace. 

Job Summary:As a Senior Data Engineer, you will design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines and workflows to support our growing data ecosystem. You will focus on creating production-ready ETL processes using Apache Airflow, integrating with diverse data stores, and ensuring all code meets rigorous development standards, including peer review, scalability, and comprehensive test coverage. The ideal candidate is a proficient developer who treats data engineering as software engineering, with hands-on experience in RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) pipelines and a track record of delivering reliable, maintainable systems.
Key Responsibilities:Develop and optimize ETL pipelines using Apache Airflow to ingest, transform, and load data from various sources into target systems.Implement production-ready code for data workflows, ensuring scalability, fault tolerance, and adherence to best practices such as modular design, error handling, and automated testing (unit, integration, and end-to-end).Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and engineering teams to build and maintain RAG pipelines that enhance AI/ML applications with accurate, context-aware data retrieval.Participate in code reviews to enforce high coding standards, promote clean, readable code, and integrate CI/CD practices for automated testing and deployment.Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines for performance, reliability, and data quality, implementing observability tools to detect and resolve issues proactively.Design and optimize data storage solutions, integrating with relational and NoSQL databases to support real-time and batch processing needs.Required Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).5+ years of hands-on experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role, with a proven background as a strong developer (e.g., proficiency in Python, SQL, and related languages).Excellent proficiency with Apache Airflow for orchestrating complex ETL workflows, including DAG creation, scheduling, and dependency management.Demonstrated experience building scalable ETL pipelines that handle large datasets, with a focus on production-ready implementation including comprehensive test coverage (e.g., using pytest or similar frameworks).Strong emphasis on software engineering practices: Experience with peer code reviews, version control (e.g., Git), and ensuring code is modular, documented, and scalable to prevent common pitfalls like brittle or unmaintainable pipelines.Familiarity with data modeling, transformation, and integration in distributed environments.Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.Preferred Qualifications:Experience with RAG pipelines, including vector databases and embedding techniques for AI-driven applications.Hands-on experience with databases such as PostgreSQL (for relational data), StarRocks (for analytical workloads), Cassandra or ScyllaDB (for high-throughput NoSQL), and Qdrant (for vector search).Knowledge of cloud data services (e.g., AWS Glue, Azure Data Factory) and orchestration tools beyond Airflow.Familiarity with monitoring and observability tools like Prometheus or OpenSearch for data pipeline health.Certifications in relevant technologies (e.g., Apache Airflow)

jobs.title: CRM Manager
jobs.description:
About EMF Media
EMF Media is a performance-driven brand studio specialised in e-commerce growth. We partner with high-potential brands to drive and sustain high-impact growth across paid media, influencer marketing, creative strategy, and CRM.Since 2020, weve helped more than 50 brands accelerate their trajectory, managing over 70 million in paid media spend, executing 25,000+ influencer activations, and generating over 350 million in tracked revenue. In the last 12 months, weve driven over 80 million in sales across a focused portfolio of high-growth e-commerce businesses.
About the Role
The CRM Manager is a core player in EMF Medias Retention & CRM team, owning the development, optimisation, and execution of email, SMS, and push marketing strategies across all lifecycle stages.His role blends performance marketing with automation strategy and creative collaboration to drive customer acquisition, repeat purchases, maximisation of lifetime value (LTV), and reduction of churn. Youll work cross-functionally with data analysts, creatives, performance teams, and lifecycle strategists to deliver highly personalised, high-impact campaigns at scale.
Key Responsibilities
1. CRM Strategy & ExecutionBuild, own, and evolve full-funnel CRM roadmaps for our e-commerce clients, ensuring lifecycle strategies are tailored to each brands growth stage, customer behaviours, and retention goals.
Manage the CRM content calendar in alignment with brand priorities and marketing campaigns.Lead the strategy and execution of automated lifecycle flows, ensuring each step is delivered by the right stakeholders (copy, design, dev) and aligned with performance goals.Oversee SMS and push notification strategies as complementary retention touchpoints.Align CRM and acquisition strategies to ensure journey continuity, while establishing and tracking performance KPIs across each client account.
2. Customer Segmentation & PersonalisationLeverage data to deliver the right message to the right user at the right time.
Define advanced segmentation strategies based on user behaviour, purchase patterns, and lifecycle stage.Implement AI-powered tools for dynamic content, personalised recommendations, and conditional logic.Continuously refine segments based on performance feedback and predictive models.Build scalable personalisation frameworks for email, SMS, and push notifications.
3. Performance Tracking & OptimisationLet performance insights drive your next iteration.
Track and optimise CRM KPIS to ensure they consistently meet performance goals and contribute to client account growth.Run structured A/B tests on subject lines, design, timing, and messaging.Build and maintain reporting dashboards for ongoing optimisation.Leverage insights to refine CRM strategy, align internal teams, and deliver clear reporting and strategic updates to clients.
4. Automation & Tech Stack ManagementBuild a smart, scalable, and reliable CRM infrastructure.
Create and manage flows in platforms like Klaviyo.Ensure clean integrations between CRM, and analytics environments.Implement predictive send times, AI-driven product blocks, and custom event triggers.Maintain compliance, deliverability, and responsiveness across all devices and inboxes.
5. Cross-Team Collaboration & Creative BriefingOperate as the connector between content, strategy, and execution.
Collaborate with Copywriters and Designers to produce high-converting, brand-aligned content.Own the briefing process for CRM assets and campaign messaging.Sync with Performance Managers to align CRM goals with launch calendars and growth pushes.Support ecommerce and retention strategies with customer-first storytelling and dynamic loyalty messaging.
Ideal Candidate Profile
35 years of experience in CRM, lifecycle marketing, or retention strategy within a DTC or e-commerce environment.If from a brand-side background, the company must have generated between 1M and 50M in annual revenue, ideally with high growth velocity.Proven hands-on experience with platforms like Klaviyo or similar CRM tools.Strong understanding of customer segmentation, automated lifecycle flows, and email/SMS strategy focused on performance.An analytical mindset with the ability to extract actionable insights from data and continuously improve results.Comfortable managing CRM campaigns end-to-end, from planning and execution to testing and reporting.Strong project management and cross-functional communication skills, especially with creative and performance marketing teams.Experience working with wellness, beauty, or lifestyle brands is mandatory.

What We Offer
Join a High-Performance TeamBe part of a fast-growing and impact-driven agency, working alongside top-tier talent focused on results.Remote & Flexible WorkWork from anywhere in France while connecting with a collaborative, high-energy team.Career Growth & LearningAccess continuous opportunities to expand your expertise, take on new responsibilities, and accelerate your career trajectory.Collaborative CultureBe part of a team that values efficiency, transparency, and shared success, where everyone contributes to collective performance.Competitive CompensationReceive a salary that reflects your skills and experience, complemented by performance-based bonuses.
Our Recruitment Process
Our hiring process is designed to assess both strategic depth and operational excellence, ensuring a strong mutual fit from day one.
Initial ApplicationA short form to understand your background, mindset, and creative approach. HR InterviewA 30-minute conversation focused on your career path, role expectations, and fit with our mission. Technical InterviewA 60-minute deep dive with your future manager, including a live technical test to assess your creative frameworks, processes, and real-time decision-making. The SprintA 4 week, part-time collaboration with the team you may join.The Sprint helps both sides validate real-world collaboration before moving forward. Leadership InterviewA final strategic discussion with the COO or CEO to ensure vision alignment and long-term fit, after the Sprint. Offer & OnboardingIf everything aligns, well extend a formal offer and begin onboarding.

jobs.title: SEO Content Manager - US/UK
jobs.description:
Hi, were Back Market.

Were here to help make tech reliable, affordable, and better than new. We're a global marketplace for refurbished devices, helping lower our collective environmental impact by providing trustworthy, affordable tech with 92% less carbon emissions than new.

Yep, you read that right. Turns out refurbished tech is way better for the planet than new. In fact, With every device purchased on Back Market, our positive impact on the planet grows. From our Customer Care representatives to our software engineer, every individual at Back Market cuts the planet  and consumers  a break. Our mission is simple: to do more with what we already have.

Are you ready to join us?

About This Position

Back Market is looking for an SEO Content & Analysis expert to support our mission of making refurbished tech the first choice around the world. This role will focus on content strategy and production for our US and UK markets. You will work in tandem with our On-Site SEO team including other Market Managers and our Global Strategist to deliver high quality content in your market to improve visibility for both SEO and GEO.

Youll play a key role in managing content production, performing tests, and supporting strategy with localized insights. Were also excited to find someone who has experience and a genuine curiosity in AI content generation and content optimization for LLM visibility. The candidate should also be very adaptable as we navigate this new evolution of search.

YOUR MISSION (IF YOU ACCEPT IT): 

Fully manage SEO visibility of your country (US and UK) and execute all actions to get maximum visibilityCollaborate with our senior SEO team members to define strategies that can grow our business in US, UK and abroad (EU Markets & Asia)Lead content agencies or other contracted service providers to get the best value they can provide in the execution of tasks and processes, ensuring quality and deadline adherenceAnalyze Googles SERP and LLM visibility and find out the best-in-class strategies for our SEO/GEOConduct regular audits to detect ranking opportunities, content gaps and pruning opportunitiesConduct backlinks audits and work with the SEO Partnership team to grow site authorityBuild a Content Calendar that fits our audiences demand and aligns with global marketing prioritiesSet up and proactively manage projects that align with our strategic goalsParticipate in weekly progress meetings to discuss our worldwide strategies and share key learnings with the teamEffectively track, prioritize, manage, and report on deliverables, assignments, and issues related to each project

YOU ARE IN THE RIGHT PLACE IF: 

2+ years of experience in SEO writing, content production and content performance analysis.1+ years experience with AI integration.Strong understanding of on-site SEO fundamentals (keyword analysis, content audits, internal linking, metadata, etc.).Analytical / Data skills (Data Studio, Tableau, GA4, Google Search Console, Google Sheet, SEO tools like Ahrefs or SEMrush)Comfortable working across markets and teamsable to switch between high-level insights and deep dives as needed.Fluency in English is required; proficiency in German is strongly preferred.Excellent organizational and time management skillsEnthusiasm for and pride in your workAbility to work efficiently and independently and adapt quickly in a dynamic environmentAbility to analyze, interpret, and present data meaningfully

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US ? 

At Back Market, were committed to hiring and supporting diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives  its one of the reasons were such a high-scoring certified B Corp company (93.2).

Benefits

No matter your role and seniority level, youll enjoy impact-driven work with hands-on career development in an innovative, driven, and fast-paced environment  with benefits to match, like:

 A mission driven work environment where your day to day makes an impact on the planet. Seriously. Hybrid work environment, with 2 remote days a week and 1 remote work week per quarter, plus 3 flex days. Employee Resource Groups, including mentorship programs, comprehensive accessibility policies, and cultural competency training.

At Back Market, we strive to create a workplace that embodies the world were trying to change. Weve embedded our diversity, equity, and inclusion principles into our DNA  from dedicated staff to employee resource groups to our company values.

We know that the perfect background for a role doesnt mean the perfect fit  we encourage you to apply for a role even if you think you may not have all the qualifications.

jobs.title: Senior Editorial Content Manager
jobs.description:
Brief Info About Vinted

Vinted is the leading second-hand fashion marketplace in Europe and a go-to destination for all kinds of second-hand items. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 60 carriers and more than 500,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace, Vinted Go, and Vinted Pay is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. Its backers include Accel, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Sprints, and TPG.

Information About The Position

Do you know how to craft a story? Can you help us elevate our organic content efforts into a newsroom-worthy conversation? We are looking for someone to lead our small but mighty social media and editorial content team, capable of creating and executing global editorial strategies. This role will sit on the Corporate Affairs leadership team and will be a key voice in shaping the overall Corporate Affairs strategy.

In this position, youll 

Lead the organic social media team, and run a high-performing content engine to support our corporate, cultural and consumer storytelling. Create our corporate content, by turning our corporate narratives into compelling writing and visual assets. Collaborate with the Executive Comms team to shape and support the social presence of senior leaders, particularly on LinkedIn. Have overall responsibility for strategy, tone, and reputation across our owned online content and social media channels. This includes supporting the consumer social media manager in your team to set content pillars and consumer tone of voice, determining crisis strategy and responses, and writing and managing high-stakes output. Use external trends and audience insights to inform content strategy and broader business decisions, ensuring relevance. Be a key member of the corporate affairs leadership team, contributing to the overall external narrative and strategy for Vinted, and supporting Corporate Affairs operations and processes. Interface with senior stakeholders, including C-level, and work cross-functionally with Brand Marketing, Influencer Marketing, Public Affairs, External Communications, Employee Brand and Sustainability to create a cohesive external story. Define clear objectives, KPIs, and a measurement framework to track performance and optimize content output, and manage reporting to demonstrate ROI. Manage resources, including overseeing agency and freelancer relationships, ensuring consistent messaging and best-in-class execution, and leveraging AI for efficiency. Push us to think differently and more creatively in how and where we tell our stories. 

About You

You are an excellent writer and communicator, you can turn info into compelling copy and visual content. You know how to tell a story. You have a deep sense of the external conversation and cultural context in which Vinted operates. You use this to ensure that our strategies land and are culturally relevant and sensitive in tone. You can translate the business strategy into a measurement framework for your team, and use KPIs and metrics to demonstrate ROI and progress against your goals. You have experience managing senior stakeholders, advising on high-stakes communications, and have demonstrated excellent judgement in these situations. You have experience in managing people, and creating a supportive environment to get the best out of your team. You possess fluency in English, both written and verbal. This is essential for creating engaging content, clear messaging, and effective audience interaction. Proficiency in any additional European languages is a plus. You are confident using data and insights to measure performance, iterate on content, and inform broader strategy. You bring a strong sense of cultural awareness and creativity, with an eye for content that earns attention and drives conversation. For a role like this, we ideally look for someone with 6+ years of experience in newsrooms, editorial roles, social media or digital marketing roles. Consumer sector experience is a plus. 

Please include examples of stories or content that you created or commissioned with your application.

Work perks 

The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme25 working days of holidayNewest MacBook modelsMental and emotional health support through the Mindletic appHome office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to 540 for home workplace furnitureA daily lunch allowancePrivate health insuranceFrequent team-building eventsA personal monthly budget for shopping on VintedThe opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workationA dog-friendly office

Working at Vinted 

Individual Learning Budget

We invest in your professional growth! As part of our commitment to continuous learning, we offer an annual learning budget to support your personal and career development through courses, certifications, workshops and more.

Hybrid Work

Weve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in office are recommended but not enforced. Its up to you and your team to decide on the exact days youll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

 Join Scaleway and shape the sovereign cloud of tomorrow !

Since 1999, we have been designing secure, sustainable Cloud and AI solutions aimed at supporting the most ambitious companies.

With the rise of artificial intelligence, we have strengthened our commitment, supported by the Iliad Group, which is investing 3 billion to develop a serious, sovereign AI alternative to American and Asian Hyperscalers.

We need someone who can hit the ground running and bring the full power of AI into our sales processes.  Develop, deploy and maintain AI-powered tools, think LLM-based solutions, data pipelines, or agentic workflows, that support Sales initiatives Build and scale ML/DL/LLM pipelines and applications, using tools like FastAPI, Scikit-learn, Pandas Experiment and integrate AI frameworks like LangChain or LlamaIndex into real use cases Work on retrieval-augmented generation, vector search systems, model evaluation, and feedback loops to drive performance Ensure production readiness: version control, CI/CD, Docker, deployment, and MLOps/LLMOps processes Occasionally, dip into Go or JavaScript if it helps move things forward Collaborate actively with cross-functional partners, Sales, product, operations, to turn prototypes into deliverables

jobs.title: Growth Marketing - Stripe Publishing
jobs.description:
Who we are

About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies - from the worlds largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups - use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone's reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About Stripe Publishing

Stripes Publishing team makes books and magazines about economic, social, and technological progress. Our two main brands are Stripe Press, which sold over 300,000 books last year, and Works in Progress, an online magazine. Later this year, Works in Progress will launch a full print magazine with paid subscriptions. Stripe Press will begin selling its entire catalogue of books directly on its website, allowing for more experimentation in pricing, bundling, and reader engagement. While many of the ideas we explore are somewhat timeless, we are very much a startup operation: growing rapidly, experimenting and iterating, and holding high aspirations for what we can build.

What youll do

Your primary goal will be to grow the reach of Works in Progress and Stripe Press: a new and highly entrepreneurial role, with no preexisting gameplan. This includes growing Works in Progresss audience online, selling Stripe Press books and Works in Progress print subscriptions, and maximising the reach of other outputs like short films and podcasts. Youll develop and execute a growth strategy across both brands, identifying the right mix of paid and organic tactics, strategic partnerships, and novel channels. Whether its getting mentions in top-tier newsletters, building a high-performing referral program, or running partnerships with conferences, youll be responsible for designing what works and delivering resultswhile upholding and strengthening Stripe Publishings distinctive taste.

Responsibilities

Run growth, partnerships, and marketing for WorksinProgress and StripePress.Produce and implement a clear growth plan that covers who we want to reach, which channels well use, how much well spend, and how well judge success.Experiment with different channels (events, newsletters, paid ads, podcast appearances, SEO and LLM search, etc.) and optimise spending over time based on whatever proves most effective.Develop and implement a social strategy designed to increase reach and audience share with thoughtful posts in line with our overall taste. Seek out and run partnershipssuch as conferences, newsletters, or joint campaignsthat put our books and magazines in front of new readers.Run launches and special offers, including price tests, limitedtime deals, and crosspromotions between the magazine and the books.Track results and share updates and lessons after each big push.Maintain basic marketing tooling (email platform, ad pixels, analytics tags) and keep data clean for reliable reporting.Set up renewal and retention efforts, like welcome emails, autorenew flows, merch and other perks, to keep subscribers and repeat book buyers.Create a simple referral program so happy readers can share and earn rewards, and track how it performs.Make sure our articles, book excerpts, and interviews rank well in search and keep drawing organic traffic.Prepare and manage the yearly marketing budget, adjusting month by month as results come in.Find, recruit and manage any external contractors or agencies required for all of the above.


Who you are

We need someone who has experience in growing the online audience of media brands that are similar to Works in Progress and Stripe Press, as well as selling things on the internet in creative ways. Experience in the book publishing industry is not essential. But we are open-minded about what the right skillset looks like: someone with experience in marketing and business development for a fast-growing consumer-focused startup may have the right skills and experience, if they know how to apply them here. You should know when to trust your gut and when to look at the data, and be able to lead this workstream by yourself.

We're looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements

5+ years experience in a senior growth-focused role for a startup, ideally (but not necessarily) in media, with a strong track record.A strong affinity for Works in Progress and Stripe Press, including a passion for economic growth and technological progress.


Preferred Qualifications

 2+ years working on online growth for a media brand, with a strong track record.


In-office expectations

Office-assigned Stripes in most of our locations are currently expected to spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This expectation may vary depending on role, team and location. For example, Stripes in our Bucharest, Romania site have an 80% in-office expectation, and those in Stripe Delivery Center roles in Mexico City, Mexico and Bengaluru, India work 100% from the office. Also, some teams have greater in-office attendance requirements, to appropriately support our users and workflows, which the hiring manager will discuss. This approach helps strike a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility when possible.

Pay and benefits

The annual salary range for this role in the primary location is 75,200 - 112,800. This range may change if you are hired in another location. For sales roles, the range provided is the roles On Target Earnings (OTE) range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidates experience, qualifications, and specific location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the primary location may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Specific benefits and details about what compensation is included in the salary range listed above will vary depending on the applicants location and can be discussed in more detail during the interview process. Benefits/additional compensation for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; retirement plans; health benefits; and wellness stipends.

jobs.description:
If youve worn a pair of glasses, weve already met.

We are a global leader in the design, manufacture, and distribution of ophthalmic lenses, frames, and sunglasses. We offer our industry stakeholders in over 150 countries access to a global platform of high-quality vision care products (such as the Essilor brand, with Varilux, Crizal, Eyezen, Stellest and Transitions), iconic brands that consumers love (such as Ray-Ban, Oakley, Persol, Oliver Peoples, Vogue Eyewear and Costa), as well as a network that offers consumers high-quality vision care and best-in-class shopping experiences (such as Sunglass Hut, LensCrafters, Salmoiraghi & Vigan and the GrandVision network), and leading e-commerce platforms.

Join our global community of over 200,000 dedicated employees around the world in driving the transformation of the eyewear and eyecare industry.

As part of our growth strategy for the Mainstream portfolio and Partner Brands (notably Nikon Lenswear and Kodak), we are looking for an experienced Marketing Manager to lead strategy and business development across the EMEA region.

Nikon Lenswear

With over 100 years of heritage, Nikon is well known for its masterful Japanese craftsmanship and advanced innovative technology in high-precision optics. The brand has a strong R&D ecosystem that supports all its business units including the ophthalmic division, Nikon Lenswear. Since 1946, Nikon Lenswear continues to hold its strong position as one of the most innovative ophthalmic brands and is home to many world's first innovations in spectacle lenses technologies. The brand is devoted to using its knowledge and understanding of sight to bring a unique life experience to each wearer of Nikons spectacle lenses.

Kodak

Since January 1, 2024, EssilorLuxottica had permanently added Kodak, one of the worlds most well-known and trusted brands, to its portfolio.

Mission

Strategic development

Define and roll out the marketing roadmap for Nikon, Kodak, and the Mainstream offer across 7 key geographies (France, Italy, Iberia, North, DACH, East, META). Drive growth, profitability, and competitiveness of Partner Brands and Mainstream segments. Identify new business opportunities (private label, trade brands) in a complex, multi-network environment. Enhance synergies with other categories (instruments, frames, Transitions, digital solutions, medical approach). 

Local execution & business performance

Support and challenge local teams to ensure best-in-class marketing plans and portfolio management. Work with Key Account Directors to strengthen positions in major accounts and tenders. Monitor business performance sales tracking, market share, and corrective action plans. 

More specifically on Nikon Lenswear

Develop and deploy the Nikon Lenswear value proposal Manage innovation's introduction & coordinate launch plans (Emea Operations, Trainings, In-store material, Comm pack) Roll out the BtC campaigns & activations in relation with Global Marketing (Nikon and Kodak), Media and PR Manage the Partnership program implementation and animation, creating content to nourish it across the region In-store experience Ensure the deployment of physical and digital solutions on the field Increase our number of doors and/or our current customers productivity by having Nikon Lenswear value proposal strong and competitive and by successfully leveraging our partnership programs with Ecps. Report to the JV our business performance but also the needs of the Region Ensure the quality of local execution, in line with brand equity and business ambition. 

More specifically on the Mainstream business

Lead product innovation to maintain a competitive portfolio. Ensure fast execution of strategic decisions with EMEA management and Key Account teams. 

Other general R&R related to the role

Define value creation pricing strategy, product positioning, margin Key contact for Operations forecasting, product definition, market roll-out etc... Support the countries to ensure efficient launches training, communication material, elements for roadshows Lead performance analysis sales tracking, in market performance, and implementation of required corrective actions in collaboration with the Business Intelligence Team 

People Management (Team based in HQ in Paris) 

1 to 2 Brand Managers + 1 interim 

Key stakeholders 

EMEA Marketing Directors and brand managers Global Lens Marketing Teams & Global Category Lead Training Team Other categories (Instruments, Frames...) Others R&D, Operations, supply chain 

Candidate Profile

Minimum 6 years+ of B2B-2C marketing experience and business development Track record in brand management, product innovation and go-to-market execution Strong command of the marketing mix pricing, product, communication, distribution. Keen to understand the technology behind the ophthalmic lenses Experience in managing and developing people directly but ability to operate into a matrix organization Additional assets experience in retail, frames, or optical industry.

With some 500 employees in 19 offices on four continents, Retarus operates locally and thinks globally: our teams are organized across borders and are highly integrated. This makes Retarus a multicultural, multilingual, and engaging workplace. We are committed to creating a diverse and dynamic environment for our employees, with generous compensation, time off, and a global, collaborative workplace.

By collaborating with leadership team, you will define clear target markets and customer segments. Additionally, you manage budgets for all regional marketing activities.

jobs.title: Head of Marketing
jobs.description:
Quandela is a European scale up that provides photonic quantum computers that are modular, scalable, energy-efficient and accessible both on the cloud and on premise. Our team of 140 employees specialises in the development of both software and hardware solutions for a variety of quantum applications. We offer a wide range of services, from developing the most efficient and brightest single photons sources, to creating algorithms for quantum computers and providing cloud quantum computing solutions. Quandela plays a pivotal role as a strategic partner in the quantum transformation of industrial sectors such as energy, finance, pharmaceuticals, and transportation. Furthermore, we are esteemed collaborators within the academic and research community.  Following a successful 50 million fundraising in 2023, we are now scaling up our commercial ventures alongside our ongoing research endeavors.  Quandela has been chosen to participate in the French Tech 2030 program, which aims to bolster French companies pioneering groundbreaking innovations.  
As a full-stack quantum computer manufacturer, we are rapidly scaling our international presence and product offerings. To support this growth, we are hiring a Head of Marketing with a strong scientific background and proven experience in marketing complex, technical products.This is a unique opportunity to shape the market positioning of a deep-tech scaleup at the forefront of the quantum revolution.You will be responsible for defining and executing Quandela's global marketing strategy, working at the intersection of product, communications, and sales. 
Your role will be instrumental in turning our technical excellence into market leadership.. You will work closely with the product department to ensure marketing strategies align with product development and roadmaps. Additionally, you will collaborate extensively with the head of corporate communication to maintain brand consistency and maximize communication impact across all channels. You will be responsible for developing and implementing comprehensive marketing strategies that effectively communicate our quantum computing solutions to target markets, drive brand awareness, and support revenue growth objectives. Your technical background combined with marketing expertise will enable you to translate complex quantum technologies into compelling value propositions that resonate with diverse stakeholders. The position of Head of Marketing will rapidly evolve with the organization. 
Key Responsibilities  Strategic Leadership: Develop and execute comprehensive marketing strategies aligned with company objectives and product roadmaps  Cross-functional Collaboration: Serve as the critical link between product development, communications, and sales teams to ensure consistent messaging and go-to-market strategies   Product Marketing: Work directly with the product department to translate technical specifications of our quantum products into clear value propositions for different industry segments and go-to-market strategies for our quantum computing solutions  Go-to-Market Execution: Lead product launches, sales enablement, messaging consistency, and cross-channel campaigns  Content Strategy: Collaborate with the head of corporate communication, research team, quantum applications teams and products teams to direct the creation of high-quality technical marketing materials, white papers, case studies, and digital content that effectively communicate our quantum computing solutions  Market Analysis: Lead research initiatives to identify market trends, competitive landscape, and customer needs in the quantum computing space  Brand Development: Partner with corporate communication to enhance Quandela's position as a thought leader in quantum computing through strategic communication initiatives and to formalize a global communication platform  Event Management: Oversee participation in industry conferences, technical exhibitions, and corporate events to showcase our quantum technology leadership  Channel Marketing: Develop strategies for partner ecosystem growth and enablement  Performance Measurement: Implement metrics and analytics to measure marketing effectiveness and ROI  Reporting: Provide regular updates to the Chief Growth Officer on marketing performance, strategy implementation, and market insights Team management: responsible for building and scaling a well-structured marketing team composed of both permanent staff (junior and senior profiles) and external partners (freelancers). Define resource needs, recruit the right talent, coordinate collaboration between internal and external contributors, and ensure a cohesive team dynamic aligned with the company's strategic objectives. 


Requirements

Required Your engineering background (Physics, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related technical field) will be imperative to deeply understand Quandela's sophisticated quantum technologies and to conceive innovative, impactful marketing strategies that translate our technical excellence into market success.
Minimum 10+ years of progressive marketing experience, with at least 3 years in leadership roles. Early-career experience as a Product Manager or in a technical function within deep tech, cloud computing, AI, or HPC environments Proven experience in technology marketing, particularly in deep tech, high-performance computing or cloud computing, or related fields.  Proven ability to build and execute marketing strategies for complex, full-stack technical products  Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex technical concepts into compelling messaging  Strong project management skills with experience leading cross-functional teams  Data-driven approach to marketing with experience in AI project management, analytics and performance measurement Led a successful initiative to embed AI into marketing operations: launching AI-powered campaigns, automating workflows, or driving smarter targeting through machine learning. Ability to turn innovation into results, and ready to bring that mindset to our next stage of growth.  Preferred Knowledge of B2B marketing in enterprise technology environments Understanding of scientific and research communities' needs and communication preferences International marketing experience Familiarity with the European technology ecosystem 
 Personal Attributes  Strategic thinker with strong business acumen  Comfortable working closely with engineering, research, and product teams to translate technical insights into clear, value-driven messaging Excellent communicator with a talent for simplifying scientific concepts and engaging diverse stakeholders (technical, business, and institutional)Creative problem-solver with a passion for emerging technologies Collaborative leader who excels in cross-functional environments Self-motivated with a hands-on approach and attention to detail Curious mind with enthusiasm for quantum computing and its applications 


Benefits

 Flexible hours and remote working  Profit-sharing and a company savings plan Annual sustainable mobility bonus for eco-friendly transport (e-bike, e-scooter, electric car) Fully covered health insurance (Alan) Referral program  Meal subsidies (Swile)  
If you're driven by challenge and inspired by the future of quantum computing, let's talk.

Bonx is a VC-backed SaaS startup revolutionizing the ERP market. We are hiring one of our first key employees, a Founding Marketing Lead, who will be responsible for massively scaling our marketing engine.  Great Location: Paris, in our offices in the Marais (75003).

Founded by Alexandre Barroux (CEO) and Rmi Bges (CTO), Bonx aims to disrupt a 50-year-old ERP market dominated by legacy players. ERPs are critical software for manufacturing companies, yet they are notoriously difficult to implement and use. Across Europe, 2.5 million SMEs are underserved by outdated ERP solutions or choose not to adopt them due to complexity. Same in the USA.

Bonx, established two years ago within OSS Ventures, has developed the first no-code, AI-driven industrial ERP. Our clients have implemented Bonx 10 times faster than traditional ERPs and continuously evolve their interfaces independently.

We aim to become the European leader in industrial ERPs within 5 years, and the global leader within 810 years. To support this ambitious growth, we are seeking a Founding Marketing Lead to join our dynamic team.

This is a founding marketing role, working directly with the CEO and the leadership team. You will act as the fuel to our growth engine, generating awareness, building community, and creating trust at scale. Youll play a key part in building a world-class marketing motion at Bonx.

What We Offer

A Real Career Accelerator: Join a top-tier SaaS team and build your marketing career the right way.Uniquely Ambitious Project: Join one of the most promising Industry 4.0 startups in Europe, backed by world-class investors (Lakestar, Dynamo Ventures, OSS Ventures, Kima Ventures).Inspiring Clients: Engage with innovative and ambitious industrial entrepreneurs.A Culture of Fun and Excellence: We aim to be the best in the ERP world  not only in performance but also in the energy and joy we bring to work every day.Growth Potential: This role is a stepping stone to future marketing leadership roles within Bonx.Global Reach: Youll be part of a team impacting manufacturing SMEs in France, Europe, and the USA.

This Role Is Not For You If

Apply for the job

jobs.title: Lifecycle Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
Gorgias is the conversational AI platform for ecommerce that drives sales and resolves support inquiries. Trusted by over 15,000 ecommerce brands, Gorgias supports growing independent shops to globally recognizable brands.

Built for Shopify and powered by advanced ecommerce integrations, Gorgias's conversational AI understands your brand, tools, policies, and customers to drive personalized, 1-to-1 conversations  from editing orders and initiating returns to making product recommendations. Gorgias, where every customer interaction feels personal, support becomes sales, and conversations shape success.

About The Team

The Lifecycle Marketing team at Gorgias builds data-driven, AI-native campaigns that support merchants throughout their journey, from just learning about us to onboarding and activation to retention and expansion. Our work sits at the intersection of Customer Experience, Product, Success, and Marketing, enabling merchants to experience value faster and scale their usage independently.

We're a team of curious, iterative builders who love to experiment, automate, and personalize at scale using prompt-based systems and modern lifecycle tooling. Youll join a nimble team that partners closely with Growth, PMMs, Marketing Operations, and Success to deliver high-impact experiences across channels and stages.

About The Role

As a member of our Lifecycle Marketing team, you will contribute to the strategy and execution of end-to-end lifecycle marketing efforts, inclusive of user onboarding, activation, engagement, retention, and revenue-generating campaigns. This role is perfect for someone whos customer-obsessed, analytical, and eager to experiment with AI-driven messaging and tooling.

Youll build and optimize lifecycle programs across email and in-product channels using segmentation, behavioral triggers, and prompt-engineered content that drives growth.

Your work will influence how merchants experience value, discover features, and expand across our product linesaccelerating time to value and supporting both self-serve and sales-assisted behaviors.

Youll report to the Senior Manager of Lifecycle Marketing and collaborate cross-functionally with teams company-wide.

What Youll Do

Design and execute multi-touch lifecycle campaigns across email and in-product to support onboarding, feature adoption, revenue generation, and retention goals.Use LLM tools and prompt engineering to generate, test, and scale lifecycle content that adapts to user and account signals and factors.Analyze product usage and merchant behavior to inform campaign segmentation, timing, and triggers.Run experiments (A/B tests, variant routing, multivariate) to test hypotheses around messaging formats, touchpoint timing, prompt quality, and engagement strategies.QA AI-generated content for brand alignment, performance accuracy, and narrative cohesion.Monitor and report on performance metrics like activation rate, NRR, and feature usage to identify areas of improvement and scale what works.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure a consistent, high-quality experience across touchpoints.

Our Current Data Stack includes:

Outreaches and Initiatives: Candu, Customer.io, Guideflow, PromptLayerCRM: Vitally and HubspotData Activation: Hightouch, Segment, Zapier, CargoData Transformation: dbt

Who You Are

Fluent in English24 years of experience in lifecycle, growth, CRM, or product marketing at a SaaS companyideally in a PLG or ecommerce environment.Proven ability to own and optimize lifecycle journeys or segments, with an eye toward accelerating product adoption and driving self-serve behaviors.Data-driven and hypothesis-oriented: you dig into usage data to segment users, form testable ideas, and iterate quickly based on results.Strong writing skills and comfort QAing AI-generated content; youve written and refined prompts to produce personalized, scalable messaging.Hands-on experience with LLMs and lifecycle tooling (e.g. GPT, Claude, Customer.io, Braze, Appcues, Pendo).Collaborative and cross-functional: youve worked closely with Product, Success, and Data to ship impactful campaigns and can clearly explain the why behind your decisions.

Perks and Benefits

Competitive salary & equity  5-week vacation plus 2 weeks RTT (We follow each country's appropriate PTO Laws) Paid sick leave Paid parental leave (16 weeks) MacBook Pro Personal credit card to buy lunches (we use Swile) We provide private health insurance (we use Alan) Get up to 700 to set up your workstation at home (working from home should feel breezy) Get up to 2000 of learning material and wellness support per year! This includes 1500 for learning material (such as books, courses, and individual coaching sessions) directly linked to your job scope, as well as a 500 wellness budget. Take advantage of these resources to grow in your role and prioritize your personal development and wellness. Every quarter, we organize an online company-wide summit to discuss where were going and strengthen social bonds. Once per year we organize offsite team retreats and company retreats!

Diversity & Inclusion at Gorgias

We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We welcome applicants of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. At Gorgias, we believe that diverse teams drive innovation and better decision-making. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other protected status.

If you need accommodations to participate in the application or interview process, perform essential job functions, or access other employment benefits, please contact us at accommodation@gorgias.com. Lets grow together!

jobs.title: Email Marketing Associate
jobs.description:
Maneuver Marketing
Our Vision, Mission & Success are fuelled by our commitment to be a driving force of positive change to the health of everyday consumers, providing conscious, high-quality & innovative supplement products.
In just 5 years, we kicked off our own DTC Health & Wellness brand from scratch and scaled it to USD$100M+ in annual sales, serving more than 3,000,000 customers worldwide with an average of 4,000 daily orders across 9 SKUs.
These results caught the attention of The Financial Times, as they ranked us among APAC top High-Growth Companies in 2023. This is just the beginning of our journey though, and you could be part of the next stage of our growth!
Your Next RoleWe are looking for a proactive, detail-oriented and data-obsessed Email Marketing Associate with at least 3 years of experience to join our fast-growing team. Your primary focus will be to help drive customer retention, revenue growth, and brand loyalty through highly effective email and SMS marketing.
You? You're totally obsessed with building smart automations, building converting lists, slicing up clean segments, protecting deliverability, ensuring flawless execution from technical setup to post-send data analysis. and turning data into winning campaigns and flows. You're fluent in Klaviyo, can set up rock-solid flows and campaigns, and know how to make data-driven decisions that drive revenue and growth.
If that's you, read on. 
You'll work closely with our retention manager, copywriters, and designers to bring emails and texts to life and continuously optimize performance through data-driven A/B testing.And, also collaborate with cross-functional teams across SMS, direct mail, product, business development, marketplace and analytics to ensure a cohesive customer journey and consistent messaging. The ideal candidate has a passion for email marketing, thrives in a fast-paced environment, and combines technical precision with strategic thinking.
What You'll Do
Klaviyo Flow Setup & Management Co-develop customer journey map with retention manager and translate the plan into emails, SMS, and DM flows Specify flow filters, triggers, conditional splits, target audience, and Klaviyo settings essential to deliver the optimal impact for the flows Implement advanced automation and segmentation strategies for acquisition and retention  including onboarding, replenishment, cross-sells, winbacks, abandons, and new offer/message tests. Map out flow logic to ensure the right messages reach the right customers at the right time, minimizing overlap and communication fatigue. Maintain and improve existing flows, auditing performance and proposing adjustments based on data insights. Document all flow structures and logic for team visibility and future reference. Identify opportunities to personalize flow content based on customer behavior, purchase history, and engagement signals. Collaborate with creative and copy teams to ensure flow content aligns with brand voice and customer journey goals. Test all new flows rigorously to confirm technical accuracy, proper audience targeting, and optimal deliverability. Monitor flow performance post-launch and proactively troubleshoot any issues (e.g. errors in triggers, audience misalignment, drops in engagement). Review and test every flow to check for typos, grammatical errors, layout issues, optimizations across mobile and desktop; and to ensure correct segmentation, logic, links, formatting, and deliverability. Monitor performance immediately after launch and again at the 24-hour, 48-hour, 1 week mark to catch and fix any issues fast.
Campaign Strategy & Development Manage the end-to-end execution of one-time and recurring email campaigns (including set up and QA for typos, grammatical errors, layout issues, optimizations across mobile and desktop, correct links, correct segments), ensuring they align with overarching marketing and retention strategies. Help Build and maintain a content calendar/strategy to support promotional, evergreen, and seasonal campaigns to meet retention, acquisition, email, and SMS KPIs Collaborate with copywriters and designers to create compelling conversion-centric email creative and email templates that meets production deadlines and maintain brand quality. Segment and target audiences for campaigns using behavioral, transactional, and demographic data. Configure all technical elements of campaigns in Klaviyo, including sending profiles, timing, throttling, and exclusion logic. Analyze campaign results and prepare actionable reports to inform future strategy and optimizations. Keep documentation up-to-date for campaign processes, templates, and learnings to improve efficiency and team knowledge sharing. Explore new Klaviyo features and tools that could enhance campaign capabilities and effectiveness. Monitor performance immediately after launch and again at the 24-hour, 48-hour, 1 week mark to catch and fix any issues fast.
Klaviyo List, Segment, Filter, and Tag Management Manage segmentation, tagging, deliverability management, and account structure hygiene inside Klaviyo. Assess, optimize, and build segments for targeting offers, product launches, and email/sms optimizations based on RFM, customer behavior, lifecycle stage, engagement, and other variables. Design and optimize pop-ups and zero-party data capture (e.g. quizzes, gated content) to grow the email list and fuel personalized segmentation and messaging. A/B split test pop ups to optimize list growth Help design and optimize lead nurturing and conversion sequences that move subscribers into buyers  and buyers into loyalists. Maintain a clean, scalable list structure with consistent tagging and naming conventions.
Deliverability Optimization Familiarize and optimize email deliverability architecture (eg. key kpis to improve deliverability and inbox placement, SPF/DKIM/DMARC configurations, ESP updates). Protect and strengthen our email deliverability by monitoring key metrics and following best practices (SPF, DKIM, DMARC setups/updates, Glockapp tests, Google Postmaster and engagement monitoring). Design mini-projects to continually improve sender reputation and inbox placement prioritizing based on highest impact. Quickly troubleshoot bounce rate spikes, spam complaints, or other deliverability red flags.
Measurement and A/B Testing Report daily, weekly, and monthly on campaign and flow performance  focusing on key revenue, engagement, deliverability metrics plus lift, not just vanity metrics. Run continuous A/B tests on subject lines, segmentation tactics, offer framing, timing, and design elements. Work closely with the measurement team to build reports using Google Data Studio and our data warehouse, or similar. Analyze and present clear insights from performance trends to guide future strategies. Continuously measure and optimize the performance of initiatives while assessing data and culling strategic insights to lead email and SMS projects Demonstrate working knowledge of attribution methodology eg. first click, last click.
Project Management Collaborate with internal teams across product, marketplace, operations, customer service, influencer, data, and growth departments Work closely with copywriter, designer, freelancers, and colleagues to meet quality standards and content production timelines working with a minimum 2 week buffer Project coordinate copywriting and design using proper tags and labels with direction from retention manager.
External Stakeholder Management Collaborate with ad agency to review and approve project roadmaps, flow charts, flow content, reports, and design Work with Klaviyo and Recart vendors to optimize campaigns, flows, pop ups, segments, and deliverability Provide deliverables to Recart, such as, copy, MMS, approved campaign schedules, flow content.
Invoice Management Compile and review email and SMS invoices to ensure accuracy Submit invoices for approval and follow up to ensure timely payments
Who You Are 3-5 years of direct, hands-on email marketing experience, ideally for DTC or eCommerce brands. Deep Klaviyo expertise  including flows, campaigns, segmentation, tagging, and reporting. Strong project management skills  you know how to juggle timelines, people, and moving pieces without dropping the ball. Excellent QA skills  attention to detail is your superpower. Analytical mindset  you love digging into data and finding actionable trends, not just reporting numbers. Strong grasp of direct response marketing principles (awareness, market sophistication, persuasion, objection handling, hooks and leads). Proven experience designing, executing, and iterating on A/B tests. Understanding of deliverability fundamentals and best practices. Comfort working cross-functionally with copy, creative, retention, and analytics teams. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced ambiguous environment where priorities can shift quickly Proactive: can take initiative and problem-solve Clear, respectful, and prompt communication with internal teams and external vendors Detail-oriented  details in flows, accuracy in invoices, and quality in content are important to you Growth mindset, adaptable, open to feedback, and driven to continuously improve how things are done Strong "builder" desire - we built our brand to 9 figures in revenue profitably with ~30 full-time employees and this would not have happened without a strong work ethic and a mission-driven culture. We aim to build the brand to 10 figures by the end of the decade, and this requires a strong sense of commitment to build something together with like-minded people. Bonus: Basic Figma, HTML, or copywriting skills.

jobs.title: Social Media Manager (Web3)
jobs.description:
We're looking for a hands-on, self-driven Social Media Manager to grow the Status movement (users, followers, contributors, and supporters), spark engagement, and build crypto twitter culture around the Status App and ecosystem.

At Status, we're building a privacy-preserving Super App for secure and confidential communication and financial coordination with friends, communities, and business partners. Status app brings together:

an anonymous, peer-to-peer privacy messenger making it easy to communicate and coordinate your financial transactions and interactions with friends and business partners in one place;a secure, self-custodial multi-chain crypto wallet to manage your crypto asset portfolio without giving up your privacy;censorship-resistant, decentralized communities for people that value privacy, freedom, and autonomy in their digital interactions.

We're expanding into chat/social, financial, and lifestyle services (splitting a bill, tips for messages, mini apps, etc.) in the Status App  while building new products across the Status ecosystem.

This is not a "corporate social media" role. We need someone to truly own our media channels and make them human, authentic, and exciting. Someone who gets meme culture, loves real conversations on social media, and knows how to spark engagement that feels alive. You'll listen, share stories, and start conversations that matter  helping grow the Status community of people building tools to take back real control over their digital lives. Our comms should be playful yet purposeful: grounded in privacy, freedom, and open source. That means showing why decentralization matters, reminding the world that privacy is a right (not a feature), and proving that open source is how we win.

You should be a driver and self-starter  ready to roll up your sleeves and take care of both the creativity and execution of our social media efforts, while working in tandem with the Program Lead on strategic planning. Your execution and strategy won't exist in isolation  they'll be an expansion of our Status product strategy and roadmap.

What you'll do:

Run our social channels (X, Reddit, YouTube, LinkedIn, Farcaster, etc.)

 

Posting, listening, engaging, and learning from the communityShare real content  memes, videos, hot takes, threads, deep dives  whatever works to spark conversation and engagementCelebrate Status ecosystem wins, highlight user stories/posts, and amplify builders, privacy advocates, and open source contributors
Bring crypto twitter and meme culture into our comms

Stay on top of crypto narratives to weave timely, relevant narratives and memes into posts and campaignsCreate and remix basic meme images, GIFs, and short videos; remix existing assets. You'll have illustrator/video creator support when neededKeep the voice right  rebellious, grounded, and human  never polished or corporate

Social listening & trend spotting & reporting/insights



Monitor crypto channels (X, Reddit, Farcaster, etc.), Web2 events/channels to spot events, discussions, and trends relevant to the Status app, SNT, and the overall Status ecosystem to leverage them in our commsFind and boost content from others in the space  especially from builders, privacy advocates, and open source contributorsKeep an ear to the ground: know what people are saying about us, about crypto, about surveillance, and help us respond thoughtfullyPropose, create, and post timely comms content: ad-hoc posts, retweets, reactive campaignsTrack social sentiment and feedback on the Status App & ecosystemUse data as a compass (not a report card) to refine strategy and execution  what's resonating? Who's engaging? Where should we show up more?

Social media strategy

Work in tandem with the Program Lead on defining social media strategy for the Status Apps and ecosystem based on our product strategy and roadmap

Content production & distribution and campaigns planning & execution



Prepare release comms: release notes (will be supported by Product), blog posts (will be supported by editors), visuals (will be supported by a visual designer when needed), teasers, and post-release messagesPlan and execute event-based campaigns (ecosystem launches, major milestones)Collaborate with partners (bridges, swaps, on/off ramps, etc.) and other projects who share our values for joint marketing and comms campaignsSuggest and roll out blog articles (with Product and editors), then promote them across channelsManage the in-app Status news feeds with comms that drive feature discovery & engagementCollaborate with the Status Community Manager to drive in-app communities and conversations.

We are looking for:

You have experience working in start-ups and are comfortable with their fast-pace and always changing/adaptable nature.

You've spent time in web3, crypto, or privacy spaces  not just as a user, but as an active participant (open source contributions, dev community activity, small projects, etc.). Tell us :)You know your way around social platforms  especially the ones where real debate happens (Reddit, long-form X threads).You write like you talk  clearly, passionately, without buzzwords.You can put together images/videos or edit them if needed (we're not asking for Hollywood  just "good enough" and authentic).You're organized without being robotic  you can plan a content calendar, but you're also ready to jump on something urgent or unexpected.You're comfortable working asynchronously, remotely, and without constant oversight. You're curious  always learning, always watching what's happening in tech, privacy, and decentralization.You believe in open source not just as code, but as a way of building power together.You are located in the European time zone or close to it.

Bonus points

You've worked with or contributed to an open source project beforeFamiliarity with or experience in growth marketing and SEO

Hiring Process:

Intro call with Talent team memberPaid taskPanel interview with Status Lead and Status Network Lead

Why this matters? 

We're not trying to be the next big tech company. We're trying to build something that outlasts them. That means every tweet, every reply, every video isn't just "content"  it's part of a bigger conversation about freedom, privacy, and who gets to shape the future of the internet.

If that fires you up  we want to hear from you.

Why AXA? Every day, we work together for human progress by protecting what matters. A mission that puts a smile on your face and makes you want to get up in the morning!

One of the world's leading insurers in the protection of property, people and assets, AXA is 145,000 employees and contributors who are committed to our customers on a daily basis, 51 countries in which we distribute our products and services and more than 90 million customers who place their trust in us worldwide. As a responsible corporate citizen, AXA is committed to social and environmental causes on a daily basis. We are committed to an inclusive policy that recognizes and values individual differences. Do these ambitions speak to you? Then come and change the world with us!

The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA) brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work.

Your Role And Responsabilities

Within the Group, you will join the Brand, Communication and Sustainability Department.

Within this Department, you will be part of AXA Groups Digital Communication Team, a core unit within the Group Communication & Engagement team, composed of about 10 multi-skilled professionals (project managers, editorial experts, social media strategists, product & tech leads).

Our ambition is to craft, deliver and amplify high-impact content that elevates AXAs voice on key topics  from leadership and innovation to sustainability, inclusion, and employee culture. The team operates as a central content hub for the Group, working in partnership with brand, internal communication, HR, and entity communications teams across the globe. The environment is fast-paced, collaborative, and transformation-oriented, with a strong emphasis on digital innovation, social media influence, and narrative consistency across channels.

We are entering a new strategic cycle with three top priorities:

Inject creativity and storytelling at every levelAccelerate influence and engagement through social platforms and leadersExperiment, scale and inspire through bold, AI-augmented content formats

The Creative Content & Social Lead will be a cornerstone of this dynamic, bringing both vision and hands-on execution to life.

The teams core mission is to design, produce and amplify high-quality corporate content aligned with the Groups strategic priorities and values.

The Creative Content & Social Lead will work cross-functionally and will help shape new content standards while fostering creative excellence across the organization.

Why this role matters

At a time when content and communications are being deeply reshaped by AI, social-first behaviors, employee advocacy, and shifting audience expectations, AXA is elevating its global corporate narrative through digital channels. To help drive this change, we are recruiting a Creative Content & Social Lead to embed creative excellence and format innovation at the heart of our global communications.

This is not just a content role: its a strategic and creative mission. It requires a sharp sense of storytelling, a deep understanding of social platforms, an eye for impactful design and motion, and the agility to co-create with stakeholders across Internal comms, Press, Branding, HR, Sustainability, and Tech & Business. This is a unique opportunity to shape how a global brand like AXA tells its story in the next era  human, digital, social-first, and bold.

The Creative Content & Social Lead will play a central role in accelerating AXAs corporate content impact by bringing creativity, storytelling, and social-first thinking to the heart of our communications. This role bridges strategic narratives and compelling digital formats, ensuring our content stands out, connects, and inspires across platforms. In this context, the key responsibilities are:

Elevate the teams creative ambition across formats, channels (internal & external), and campaigns.Lead creative ideation and content-driven thinking to boost Employee Engagement, Social Engagement, AXAs influence, distinctiveness, and impact.

Creative Direction & Content Ideation

Lead creative ideation for key campaigns and content initiatives (brand, social impact, leadership, innovation)Translate strategic messages into engaging, human-centered content formats: short videos, carousels, podcast scripts, reels, infographics, interactive visualsEnsure brand tone, consistency and originality across all creative assets

Social-First Strategy

Boost AXAs presence and influence on social platforms by driving format innovation and content optimizationBoost Employee engagement and Sociable platform adoption by driving format innovation, new feature usage and content optimizationPartner with the Social Media Manager, Advocacy Manager and Internal communication lead to amplify social media engagement, leadership voices and employee engagementLead content pilots using emerging platforms

Solid background in digital content, brand storytelling, or creative social mediaExperience in both concept development and content executionPrevious exposure to corporate topics or complex organizations is a strong plusFluency in English; French is a plus depending on stakeholder interactions

Skills
